intro: Pavetta redheadii, commonly known as Redhead's pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and are often fragrant. The leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
